reviewText:
SPORE™ Creepy & Cute Parts Pack... for all of your creative needs

SPORE™ Creepy & Cute Parts Pack adds new parts, colors, and animations to the Creature Creator feature of SPORE™. This is quite an expensive expansion with a twenty dollar price tag, on top of you being required to pay the twenty for SPORE™, even though this is not a DLC, but a standalone game.

This game has a total of 84 new creature parts which is 24 parts more than advertised, 48 new colors, 24 new animations, and 2 new testing area backgrounds.

New parts:
12 heads
12 eyes
12 arms
12 legs
12 hands
12 feet
12 details

New Colors:
12 completed styles
36 partial styles (6 in each coat, detail, and base)

New Actions:
6 actions in every category

New test run area backgrounds:
one good
one bad


A total of 158 extras, so they each cost about 13 cents. There's nothing added to the main core of this game, just the parts, which add some, but not a lot of extra creating time. BUT, the parts are pretty cool and let you finally build those adorable alien rabbits and killer crocodile flying space creatures you've always wanted to build.

Get this if it’s on sale, you use creator heavily, or if you absolutely just love the SPORE™ franchise.

Anything done in SPORE™ Creepy & Cute Parts Pack will show up in your copy of SPORE™

Curator page:
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6857919/

reviewText: Hello there, another review here! This one is going to short and simple. This expansion pack for Spore has very unique and interesting new parts and skin designs. Adding more creativity to the game. Sadly, that is all this expansion has to offer, I do think they could of added more. Considering the price, it's a rip off, do not waste $20 on this. Wait for it to go on sale for $10 or lower for a deal worth making.\n\n5.5/10

reviewText:
Before reading please note, THIS REVIEW IS OF THE DLC, NOT THE GAME. Now that that's out of the way...

Okay, here's the deal. I love Spore. Like, a LOT. So, when it went on sale a while back, I decided to re-buy it (I owned the disc version, but lost the code, so I basically didn't own it). DLC was only like, $5, and I played Galactic Adventures (I loved it, but that's a review for ANOTHER day). Honestly, it was hardly worth the $5.

So if you don't know, the Creepy & Cute pack adds some new creature parts and patterns, but that's it. The arms and legs are literally all bug parts, so nothing I want to use there, some cool new other bits, though. For patterns, some feel Creepy" like one pattern that looks kind of like muscles
date: and not so much cute (though it does add a feather pattern
hoursPlayed: which is awesome because I love building birds in this game). It doesn't really add too many parts
voteText: and quite a few of them feel like they should be part of the game already.\n\nThe other problem is that it ONLY adds creature parts. No new clothes
votesTotal: the new animations are only in the test drive mode. They're cool to watch
votesFunny: but would be even cooler to see in game. Oh
commentsCount: and another thing that bothers me (But isn't a deal breaker by any means) is the fact that because of how the expansions worked pre-steam
column16: Steam tracks my hours while playing Creepy & Cute
column18: which means I have to play without my extra parts if I want steam trading cards.\n\nOverall
column19: don't waste $20 on this expansion. If you have $20 burning a hole in your wallet
column21: try out Galactic Adventures. It's pretty awesome
column22: if I do say so myself (owned the Expansion for Disc
column23: so yeah. I plan on getting it on a sale or something).\n\nTL;DR: Doesn't really add a whole lot. Not worth $20
column24: though might be worth it if it's on sale.\n\nDon't forget
column25: THIS IS REVIEW OF THE DLC
column26: NOT THE GAME. I love Spore

reviewText:
This seemed like just a DLC for the original SPORE game, but it seems like this pack is another game in itself. You need the SPORE base content to launch it, but it is counted as it's own game you can launch, and not technically a DLC.

The SPORE: Creepy & Cute Parts Pack has a bit of extra content that makes the game creepy & cute, and SPORE franchise fans would enjoy the small but unique addition this pack gives to the game. It's not a whole lot, but it's good in it's own right.

I would recommend getting the SPORE: Creepy & Cute Parts Pack on sale when the SPORE games are bundled for a fraction of their regular price. Since the three SPORE games on Steam are so similar to each other, getting the bundled discount when they are on sale is the best way to save your money and get all your money's worth too at the same time.

reviewText:
I would like to know what this expansion is like, but the parts simply don't appear in the game and neither EA's nor Steam's customer support gives a ♥♥♥♥ about my support tickets on this matter.

After 5 months of no reply from EA's support, I reposted my ticket, and they sent me over to Steam's support. This was 2 months ago, and I got no response for my Steam ticket so far. Customer Service 1/10 for both companies...

Update after another 2 months of trying to fix the game without any help from customer support:
Steam ended up sending me back to EA support, which remained uncontactable.

Following a user guide I finally managed to fix the game. The parts are finally working, yay. Was it worth all the effort? Not really, but oh well, finally I get the value what I paid for.

If you can get it hassle-free, go for it. Or wait, for £10, holy ♥♥♥♥ nope, get it on a steep sale or in a bundle. The pack literally only contains some extra parts for your creatures.

reviewText: See my review of Spore (main game) for the full review. Other than that, the Creepy and Cute Parts Pack (C&C going forward) adds over 100 new parts for your creatures, buildings, and vehicles, including your soaceship in the space stage. Is it worth it, though? Well, if you want more variety than the already vast offerings of the original Spore, than this might be for you. In my opinion though, wait until it goes on sale as a bundle with either Spore and C&C, or if you own the original, wait until the dlc goes on sale. As of writing this, Spore and C&C are on sale as a bundle for $30, and the C&C's normal price is $20. In this case it is not worth it in my opinion, wait on a better sale. Don't get me wrong, Spore and C&C are wicked fun, but all this adds is another level of customization, and as previously stated, there is already an incredible amount built into Spore itself.
